p: Large, unpredictable epidemics have been a part of American life for centuries, starting in 1793 with yellow fever in Philadelphia. 62 Then, as today, epidemics are inextricably tied to the movements of people, and to trade, as through the port of Philadelphia. Indeed, the responsibilities accorded the Department of Homeland Security—explicitly linking health and human to national security—included the mandate to protect “the agriculture and food system against terrorist attacks, major disasters and other emergencies.” 63
